summary.p: Bound codex, made of folios and quires of various measurements. Contains mostly handwritten notes, all presumably by Édouard Ariel, but also some printed matters pasted on the pages. Intertitle-pages divide the volume by subject, while many folios bear a top header. Contains lists of Tamil texts by alphabetical order. Contains, with a focus on the Tamil South of India, notes, and bibliographical references bearing on literature, history, religion.

The contents of U1 are:
lf1r: title page of volume.
lf2r-lf54v: list of works in Tamil and Sanskrit in alphabetical order. Letters of the Tamil alphabet in the page header: e.g. A. Ā. (lf2r).
lf55‒lf60: 3 isolated items (in fact only 3 folios, folded in two as longer [320 x 220 mm] than the others in the volume:) and bound in, that is:
instructions in Tamil for blackening engraved letters on palm leaves and for protecting palm leaves from insects,
a list of Sanskrit poets,
brief entries for Vedāntadeśika and Vedāntācārya.
lf61r‒lf142r: purāṇas, legends, biographies.
lf143r‒lf178r: epics.
lf179r‒lf183r: literature.
lf184r‒lf194r: Sanskrit literature.
lf196r‒lf203v: Tamil literature.
lf205r‒lf212r: South Indian literature.
lf214r‒lf222r: North Indian literature.
lf225r‒lf242v: Indian dramatic literature.
lf244r‒lf248v: Incomplete works.
lf249r‒lf267r: list of Tamil printed books in Ariel’s library, arranged by genre/topic, with letter+number reference system.
lf268r‒lf284r: list of Tamil manuscripts (palm leaf and paper) in Ariel’s library, arranged by genre/topic, with letter+number reference system.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (February 2025).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

support.p: Paper of various types, colours, and sizes.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on verso. Verso marbled (that is, one pasted bifolio covers verso of front cover and recto of front guard leaf).
1 folio = front guard leaf. 275 x 220 mm. Blank recto verso. Recto marbled (that is, one pasted bifolio covers verso of front cover and recto of front guard leaf).

285 folios = Bibliography. Library Arabic foliation 1-284, 285. Paper of various types, colours, and sizes (but not exceeding 275 x 220 mm). The intertitle pages are of same format, type, and hand (Ariel’s). Sometimes paper sheets (handwritten printed) pasted. See e.g. f146r.
1 folio = back guard leaf. 275 x 220 mm. Blank recto verso. Verso marbled (that is, one pasted bifolio covers verso of front guard leaf recto of front cover).
the back cover. Recto marbled (that is, one pasted bifolio covers verso of back guard leaf and recto of back cover).

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 165 (front cover, verso).
BnF shelfmark in black pencil: Tamoul N° 165 (lf1r).
Various stamps: SOCIETE ASIATIQUE (lf1r), BIBLIOTHEQUE IMPERIALE MSS. (lf2r, lf284v), DON N° (lf2r).

binding.p: Bound codex, containing folios and quires of various measurements. Hard paper covers.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not dated by Vinson (1868) nor by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Papers of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, Département des Manuscrits, Inventaire 7 = dons : manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, n° 1 à 3306: no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 28.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien (1867‒1868). Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls. Corrected proofreadings printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. Access No. 4-IMPROR-77 (B). — See p. 41.
